TopicTitle: Tune in to KSPTV at 18:00 CST for Episode Zero of SQUADCAST!

Articles.Content:
Episode Zero will be an introduction to what will become a weekly show from the makers of Kerbal Space Program.

This week's episode will include a look at a more complete version of some of the 0.22 features shown at PAX, with in-depth explanations of their functions.

If only it wasn't at 1 in the night here in Europe. That is quite late even on a Friday.

I will see if I can keep awake after a long week at work.

If only it wasn't at 1 in the night here in Europe. That is quite late even on a Friday.I will see if I can keep awake after a long week at work.
I can second this as another European (And dane too, woo!).It would be nice to have it earlier, but I guess it won't work for you americans.

This time is very impractical. I think I could cope with 16:00 (CST) but that is still late for a lot of people and is 10PM in england. Still better than midnight.

Edited September 6, 2013 by jamieadd
better descrition of issue
It's very nice that these devstreams are coming back, but as some people already said, just two-three hours earlier would be ok. It's Friday after all, a little late it can be
Cool! It's a good thing that I live where CST is used!

will we be able to watch it again(just to know if I can watch it another day)?

Edited September 6, 2013 by goldenpeach
forgot the question mark(yeah,it deserve a big face palm)

This is great news !! Im super looking forward to it! Also two things,

1) I think it would be better to use GMT(Greenwich Mean Time) format for what time Squadcast starts, I think it would be easier for the international community.

2) Do these get archived for later viewing?

Thanks for all the hard work!!!

This Stream was soooooooo cool !

Thanks a lot Max, nice to be in touch with you devs again

Keep them coming !

<3

Hey guys! I welcome any and all feedback you may have about it. Episode zero was sort of meant to be a short introduction and going into what we're going to be doing, but I hope you enjoyed it as well as the proper 0.22 video.

Tune in next week!

It looks so incredibly awesome.

A suggestion regarding publicity for KSPTV: announcement including a link in "Latest Articles" on the forum front page, and a link in the menu bar on that same page. As it is now people have trouble finding it.
Looks amazing
@Maxmaps GMT please ? I am British so...
*spits out imaginary water*
GMT please? I'm EST but I can easily convert from GMT. CST is GMT-5 I think so that makes it what, 2300 GMT? That puts it at pretty much midnight for people in europe, 5PM for me.
I watched from around ten to eleven EST (murica.png); how can one person be so good at this game?

CST is GMT / UTC - 5.

Also you can easily use a site like this one to convert any time zone to any other (it takes daylight saving time into account).
